fullText: You don’t have be Cuban to feel the nostalgia, romance, loss, liberation, joys and pride in such well-lived music.
dtliExcerpt: Home Legit Reviews Mar 19, 2025 7:00pm PT ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ Review: Exuberant New Broadway Musical Celebrates the Soul of a Nation By Frank Rizzo Plus Icon Frank Rizzo Latest ‘Ragtime’ Review: Broadway Revival Is a Timely, Glorious Panorama of Changing Times in America 3 months ago ‘Waiting for Godot’ Review: Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter Bring a Cooler, Cosmic Take to This Broadway Waiting Game 4 months ago ‘Call Me Izzy’ Review: Jean Smart Dazzles in a Broadway Play That Treads All-Too-Familiar Territory 7 months ago See All Matthew Murphy Entering " Buena Vista Social Club " is like stepping into a heady world of the senses, of heightened emotions, and of passionate music and dance. The Social Club was a real place for locals in Havana in the '50s. Decades later, its music became the source of a Grammy-winning album, then a popular film — and now it's the most intoxicating and rapturous show of the Broadway season.
